commitResults.messageBody:
- Store text entered by the user into an array
- When requested, display all tasks in the list
- Ability to mark classes as "done" and unmark classes as "undone"

- Add ToDo, Deadline and Event classes

- Add new commands to handle ToDo, Deadline and Event tasks
- Altered code to make use of TaskManager class to handle operations such as adding tasks, marking tasks and unmarking tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated use of TaskManager to handle inputs

commitResults.messageBody: - Usage of Input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT files to redirect input and output to semi-automate the testing of Duke functions.
- Added DukeException and other exceptions inheriting from DukeException to handle various invalid inputs
- Created new function to handle deleting of tasks

- Introduce new classes to handle parsing of commands and printing of responses

- New storage class to save user tasks locally

- Created a new DateParser class to handle parsing of dates, from date to string, and from string to date formats.

- Store Deadline and Event dates as java LocalDate objects, and print them in a different format.
- Package all files under "duke" package

- Setup JUnit tests using Gradle

- Created ParserFileTest to test the parsing of local storage file used to save tasks

- Created DateParserTest to test the parsing of dates used in the Deadline and Event tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Configure Gradle files to create JAR file
commitResults.messageBody: - Edit build.gradle and gradle-wrapper.properties to create JAR file

- Implement testing for parsing of tasks into strings to be written to storage

- Fix indent on switch statements
- Add JavaDocs documentation to the project

- Change file to adhere to the module coding standard

- Fix Checkstyle violations
- Search command to allow users to search for tasks matching a description
- Find tasks matching a given date by using the "date" command followed by a date string
- Added a graphical user interface to the Duke application

commitResults.messageTitle: Assert that LocalDate object parsed into a String is not null
commitResults.messageBody:
- DateParser::dateToString assumes that the LocalDate object is a valid LocalDate and attempts to parse it into a String

- However, passing in a null object as an argument for the function is possible and may lead to errors during the invoking of this function

- Adding an assertion to the start of this function ensures that the LocalDate object cannot be null

commitResults.messageTitle: Creating a new function to format a list of tasks as a String
commitResults.messageBody:
- Previously, the methods TaskManager::list, TaskManager::findByDate and TaskManager::find individually handles the parsing the list of tasks as a string

- This leads to code duplication as all three functions handle the same behaviour individually

- By creating a new method TaskManager:listTasks, this helps to reduce code duplication as all three functions can now call TaskManager::listTasks to concatenate the tasks as a string.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use of streams to find tasks matching a description
commitResults.messageBody:
- Previously the TaskManager:find method utilises a for loop to iterate through elements of the taskList to find those that matches the description given by the user input

- This is not as efficient as using a stream to filter the tasks

- Hence, the taskList is first converted into a stream

- Using the Stream:filter method, we can then sieve out tasks that match the given description

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix coding standard violations and improve code quality
Implement feature to update tasks given the index number of the task
commitResults.messageBody:
- Remove 'final' keyword on the Task description

- Allowing the updating of task description
